org.ow2.chameleon.core.utils

Class FrameworkClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • java.security.SecureClassLoader
        • java.net.URLClassLoader
          • org.ow2.chameleon.core.utils.FrameworkClassLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class FrameworkClassLoader
extends URLClassLoader
    The classloader responsible to load the framework classes and providing access to the classes and resources from the Jar's located in the 'libs' directory. The 'libs' directory contain non-bundle jars that are scanned and 'exported' by the framework. This feature only work for Apache Felix (no Eclipse Equinox is not supported).

    The Framework is loaded in a different classloader to access the jar contained in the 'libs' directory. Notice that the framework jar must be in the Chameleon's classpath.

    • Field Detail

      • PREFIXES

        private static List<String> PREFIXES
        The set of packages that need to be defined by the classloader (and not loaded by the parent).

      • classes

        private Map<String,Class> classes
        The set of defined classes.

      • libsClassLoader

        protected final URLClassLoader libsClassLoader
        A classloader limited to the jars contained in the 'libs' directory. This classloader is used to ensure the resolution order: 1) the jars file from the 'libs' directory and 2) the parent class loader (classpath). The parent of this classloader can be configured using the chameleon.libraries.parent property.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrameworkClassLoader

        private FrameworkClassLoader(File basedir,
                             String librariesParentPolicy)
        Creates the classloader.

        All jars from the 'libs' directory are added to the classloader.

        Parameters:
        basedir - the base directory. The 'libs' folder must be a direct child of this directory.
        librariesParentPolicy - the delegation policy for the library classloader

      • hasToBeDefined

        public static boolean hasToBeDefined(String name)
        Checks whether or not the given class name must be defined by the .FrameworkClassLoader or by the parent class loader.

        It checks if the class is in one of the packages listed in .FrameworkClassLoader#PREFIXES.

        Parameters:
        name - the class name
        Returns:
        true if the class must be defined by the framework's classloader, false otherwise.

      • loadClass

        public Class loadClass(String name)
                throws ClassNotFoundException
        Loads a class. If the class needs to be defined by this classloader, the byte code of the class is retrieved from the classpath and defined. Otherwise, the parent classloader is used.

        If the byte code of the class cannot be found, it delegates to the parent.

        Defined classes are stored, and not redefined.

        Overrides:
        loadClass in class ClassLoader
        Parameters:
        name - the class name
        Returns:
        the loaded class
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the class cannot be found

      • getByteCode

        private byte[] getByteCode(String classname)
                    throws IOException
        Gets the byte code of the given class. The '.class' file is loaded using the parent classloader.
        Parameters:
        classname - the class name
        Returns:
        the byte array containing the byte code. An empty array is returned if the '.class' file cannot be found.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error happens while reading the '.class' file

      • jars

        public static URL[] jars(File dir)
        Builds a array of URLs containing all the jar file from the given directory. If there are no jar files in this directory or if the directory does not exist, an empty array is returned. The lookup is recursive.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory
        Returns:
        the array of urls.
